ns5:UMLClass.description: An instance of the Security Service Metadata.

ns5:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: A software system providing a public need.
Security; freedom from anxiety or fear.
Data about data; information that describes another set of data.

ns2:Operation.description: This method allows a CSM Web Service administrator to create an application context for managing security policy.
ns2:Operation.name: createApplication

ns2:Operation.description: This method allows a CSM Web Service administrator to remove an application context.
ns2:Operation.name: removeApplication

ns2:Operation.description: This method allows an administrator of an application to create a protection element in that application.
ns2:Operation.name: createProtectionElement

ns2:Operation.description: The method allows an administrators of an application to search for protection elements associated with that application.
ns2:Operation.name: getProtectionElements

ns2:Operation.description: This method allow an application administrator to modify a protection element associated with the application.
ns2:Operation.name: modifyProtectionElement

ns2:Operation.description: This method allows an application administrator to remove a protection element.
ns2:Operation.name: removeProtectionElement

ns2:Operation.description: This method allows an application admin to create a protection group.
ns2:Operation.name: createProtectionGroup

ns2:Operation.description: This method allows an application admin to search for protection groups associated with the application.
ns2:Operation.name: getProtectionGroups

ns2:Operation.description: This method allows an application admin to modify a protection group associated with the application
ns2:Operation.name: modifyProtectionGroup

ns2:Operation.description: This method allows an admin to remove a protection group associated with the application.
ns2:Operation.name: removeProtectionGroup

ns2:Operation.description: This method allows a application admin to assign protection elements to a protection group.
ns2:Operation.name: assignProtectionElements

ns2:Operation.description: This method allows a application admin to unassign protection elements from a protection group.
ns2:Operation.name: unassignProtectionElements

ns2:Operation.description: This method gets a list of protection elements assigned to a protection group.
ns2:Operation.name: getProtectionElementsAssignedToProtectionGroup

ns2:Operation.description: This method alls an application admin to assign a protection group as a child or another protection group.
ns2:Operation.name: assignProtectionGroup

ns2:Operation.description: This method allows an application admin to unassign a protection group from being a child of a protection group.
ns2:Operation.name: unassignProtectionGroup

ns2:Operation.description: This method allows an application admin to get a list of child protection groups for a protection group
ns2:Operation.name: getChildProtectionGroups

ns2:Operation.description: This method allow an application admin to get a list of the groups associated with the application.
ns2:Operation.name: getGroups

ns2:Operation.description: This method allows an application administrator to link a Grid Grouper group to CSM, such that access control policy may be provisioned based on membership to the Grid Grouper group.
ns2:Operation.name: linkRemoteGroup

ns2:Operation.description: This method allow an application admin to unlink a remote Grid Grouper group from CSM.
ns2:Operation.name: unlinkRemoteGroup

ns2:Operation.description: This method allows a application admin to create a local group of users on the CSM Web Service
ns2:Operation.name: createGroup

ns2:Operation.description: This method allows an application administrator to remove a local group.
ns2:Operation.name: removeGroup

ns2:Operation.description: This method allows an application administrator to modify the metadata of a local group.
ns2:Operation.name: modifyGroup

ns2:Operation.description: This method allows an application admin to add users to a user group
ns2:Operation.name: addUsersToGroup

ns2:Operation.description: This method allows an application admin to remove users from a user group.
ns2:Operation.name: removeUsersFromGroup

ns2:Operation.description: This method allows an application admin to get a list of the users in a user group.
ns2:Operation.name: getUsersInGroup

ns2:Operation.description: This method allow an admin to create privileges.
ns2:Operation.name: createPrivilege

ns2:Operation.description: This method allows one to search for privileges
ns2:Operation.name: getPrivileges

ns2:Operation.description: This method allows an admin to remove a privilege.
ns2:Operation.name: removePrivilege

ns2:Operation.description: This method allo.ws an admin to modify a privilege
ns2:Operation.name: modifyPrivilege

ns2:Operation.description: This method allows an application administrator to create a role.
ns2:Operation.name: createRole

ns2:Operation.description: This method allows and admin to get a list of roles based on a specified search criteria.
ns2:Operation.name: getRoles

ns2:Operation.description: This method allows an application admin to modify a role.
ns2:Operation.name: modifyRole

ns2:Operation.description: This method allows an application admin to remove a role.
ns2:Operation.name: removeRole

ns2:Operation.description: This method allows an application admin to set the privileges that make up a role.
ns2:Operation.name: setPrivilegesForRole

ns2:Operation.description: This method allows an application admin to get the privileges associated with a role.
ns2:Operation.name: getPrivilegesForRole

ns2:Operation.description: This method allows an admin to grant a permission to a user group.
ns2:Operation.name: grantGroupPermission

ns2:Operation.description: This method allows an application admin to revoke a permission from a user group.
ns2:Operation.name: revokeGroupPermission

ns2:Operation.description: This method allows an application admin to grant a user a permission.
ns2:Operation.name: grantUserPermission

ns2:Operation.description: This method allows an application admin to revoke a permission from a user.
ns2:Operation.name: revokeUserPermission

ns2:Operation.description: This method allows application admins to get the permission granted to a user.
ns2:Operation.name: getPermissionsForUser

ns2:Operation.description: This method allows an application admin to get the permissions granted to a user group.
ns2:Operation.name: getPermissionForGroup

ns2:Operation.description: This method allows an application admin to get the parent protection group of a protection group.
ns2:Operation.name: getParentProtectionGroup

ns2:Operation.description: This method allow one to determine if a user has been granted a privilege on a resource.
ns2:Operation.name: checkPermission

ns2:Operation.description: This method allows one to determine whether or not a user has been granted a privilege on a resource.
ns2:Operation.name: checkAttributeBasedPermission

ns2:Operation.description: This method allows an application admin to create a filter clause.
ns2:Operation.name: createFilterClause

ns2:Operation.description: This method allows an application admin to modify a filter clause.
ns2:Operation.name: modifyFilterClause

ns2:Operation.description: This method allows an application admin to search for filter clauses for an application.
ns2:Operation.name: getFilterClauses

ns2:Operation.description: This method allows an application admin to remove a filter clause.
ns2:Operation.name: removeFilterClause

ns2:Operation.description: creates a resource to be used to generate instance level security filters
ns2:Operation.name: createFilterCreator

ns2:Operation.description: creates a FilterCreator reference by using a domain model to navigate the filter classes
ns2:Operation.name: createFilterCreatorFromDomainModel

ns55:UMLClass.description: For a Data Service, this is the data model it is based on.

ns55:UMLAttribute.description: The version of the Domain Model Project.
ns55:UMLAttribute.name: projectVersion

ns55:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: Any piece of work that is undertaken or attempted.
Version; something a little different from others of the same type; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.

ns55:UMLAttribute.description: A description of the Domain Model Project.
ns55:UMLAttribute.name: projectDescription

ns55:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: Description; a statement that represents something in words.
Any piece of work that is undertaken or attempted.

ns55:UMLAttribute.description: The short name for a Domain Model.
ns55:UMLAttribute.name: projectShortName

ns55:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: Having little (physical) length or seeming to be limited in (temporal) duration.
Any piece of work that is undertaken or attempted.
The words or language units by which a thing is known.

ns55:UMLAttribute.description: The long name for a Domain Model.
ns55:UMLAttribute.name: projectLongName

ns55:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: Of relatively great or greater than average spatial extension or temporal duration.
Any piece of work that is undertaken or attempted.
The words or language units by which a thing is known.
An area of knowledge considered as a discreet unit for some purpose.
1. A representation of something, often idealized or modified to make it conceptually easier to understand. 2. Something to be imitated. 3. In dentistry, a cast.

ns58:UMLClass.description: An instance of the Security Service Metadata.

ns58:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: A software system providing a public need.
Security; freedom from anxiety or fear.
Data about data; information that describes another set of data.

ns2:Operation.description: returns the available target classes in this application
ns2:Operation.name: getClassNames

ns60:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: A service available on a system that coordinates resources that are not subject to central control, using open, general purpose protocols and interfaces to deliver nontrivial qualities of services.

ns61:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: A published API which receives data in the form of objects, performs computations based upon the input data, and returns information to a client via caGrid in the form of one or more objects.
